questions.question: What is the OSI model?
questions.explanation: OSI: framework for network communication. Layers: 7 levels. Purpose: standardize communication. Development: ISO standard. Use: reference model. Education: teaching tool. Importance: networking foundation.

questions.question: What is Layer 1 (Physical)?
questions.explanation: Layer 1: electrical signals, cables. Equipment: hubs, cables, connectors. Data: bits (0,1). Task: transmit raw bits. Examples: Ethernet cable, fiber optic. Importance: lowest level.

questions.question: What is Layer 2 (Data Link)?
questions.explanation: Layer 2: frames, MAC addresses. Devices: switches. Task: frame delivery within LAN. Protocol: Ethernet. Error: detects errors. Importance: local network communication.

questions.question: What is Layer 3 (Network)?
questions.explanation: Layer 3: IP addresses, routing. Devices: routers. Task: end-to-end delivery. Protocol: IP (IPv4, IPv6). Scope: global network. Importance: internet communication.

questions.question: What is Layer 4 (Transport)?
questions.explanation: Layer 4: reliability, flow control. Protocols: TCP (reliable), UDP (fast). Ports: 65536 available. Task: complete communication. Services: connection, error checking. Importance: reliability layer.

questions.question: What is Layer 5 (Session)?
questions.explanation: Layer 5: conversation management. Task: establish, maintain, terminate. Sessions: authentication, authorization. Example: login sessions. Complexity: less commonly implemented. Importance: conversation control.

questions.question: What is Layer 6 (Presentation)?
questions.explanation: Layer 6: data translation, formatting. Task: encryption, compression, translation. Examples: JPEG, SSL/TLS. Purpose: readable format. Complexity: often combined with layer 7. Importance: data preparation.

questions.question: What is Layer 7 (Application)?
questions.explanation: Layer 7: user applications. Protocols: HTTP, FTP, SMTP, DNS. Task: user interface. Examples: browser, email client. Interaction: directly with users. Importance: visible to end users.

questions.question: What does PDU mean?
questions.answer: Protocol Data Unit at each layer
questions.explanation: PDU: layer-specific format. Names: data, segment, packet, frame. Each: layer adds headers. Example: frame at layer 2. Importance: encapsulation concept. Task: segment data.

questions.question: What is encapsulation?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation: wrap data in headers. Process: top-down through layers. Headers: contain control information. Purpose: routing, delivery. De-encapsulation: unwrap at destination. Importance: fundamental concept.
